title: Classroom-Based Instructional Design Workshop for Understanding Elementary Mathematics Operational Properties

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary mathematics curriculum and foundational teaching methodology experience
context.additional_context: Short intensive course for current practitioners to experiment with and analyze effective teaching methods for elementary mathematical properties (commutative property, additive identity, additive inverse).

learning_goals: Participants can classify at least three types of elementary learners' understanding of operational properties using Skemp's instrumental-relational understanding framework
Participants can propose at least two classroom activities teaching operational properties (additive identity, inverse, commutative property) through hands-on experiments
Participants can develop two strategies for solving compound operational property problems (combining â‰¥2 properties) and explain effectiveness verification methods

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
